Wing field and Miss Julia Wingfield spent Tuesday night and Wed nesday with Mr. and Mrs. James Waldron and family, of Bedford. The family of the late Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Smith held their family reunion Sunday with Rev. and Mrs. Otis Smith. Visiting Mrs. C. R. Banton Sunday afternoon were Rev. and Mrs. J. R. Darden and two chil dren, of Lyndhurst, Va., Mrs. Peggy Hartness and Mrs. Vir ginia Shaw and daughter, of Phe- nix. Mr. and Mrs. Carlton Smith and family, of Richmond, and Mr. and Mrs. Calvin Smith and am ily, of Charlotte, N.C., were week end guest of their parents, Rev. and Mrs. Otis Smith.The Calvin Smiths are spending this week in this home. Mrs. Richard Thorman, Mrs. Raymond Franklin, Wesley, Ri cky and Pam and Mr. and Mrs. Ronnie Woodall called in the home of Mrs. Charlie Bagby Monday. document.text: We had a wonderful revival at Hollywood last week. Rev. R. G. Roland, Jr., of Gretna, was the guest evangelist. He brought us some wonderful messages. Special music was furnished by the McIntoshs  E l d e r s of Rocks Church, Rev. R. G. Ro land, a quartet from Appomat tox Methodist Church, a quartet from Cedar Baptist Church, of Buckingham, a trio consisting of Diane Smith, Joanne Elder and Sarah Brown and the church choir. The family of the late Mr. and Mrs. John W. Webb and some of the family of the late Mr. and Mrs. Luther Webb held a family reunion Sunday at the home of Mr. and Mrs. R. M. Webb and Mr. Walker Webb. Mrs. Richard Thorman, of Arlington, mother of Mrs. Ray mond Franklin is visiting Mr. and Mrs. Franklin and family. Mr. and Mrs. Joe Baldwin, of Richmond, spent Sunday with their sister, Mrs. M. L. Cov ington. Miss C a s s i e Baldwin and Mrs. Edna Covington visited Mrs. Charlie Bagby last week and attended the Hollywood re  vival. Mr. and Mrs. Leslie Turns, Mrs. Eula Gilliam and Mr. Ben nett Gilliam, of Farmville, vis ited Mrs. Edna Covington Sat urday evening. Visiting Mrs. Virgie Beasley last week were Mrs. C l a u d e Hamlett and Brenda, Mrs. Ed win Schampel and Mr. Grover Beasley, Jr. Mr. and Mrs. Ronnie Woodall   visited Mr. and Mrs. W. H. j Wingfield and family Sunday  afternoon. document.text: Mr. and Mrs. R a y m o n d Franklin, Wesley, Rickey and Pam spent the week end in Ar lington with Mrs. Franklins mother, Mrs. Richard Thorman and family. Mrs. Sadie Beard of Vienna, Va., is spending some time with Mr. and Mrs. H. W. Jenkins. Lonnie Rogers of Richmond, spent a few days with his grand parents, Mr. and Mrs. James E. Maxwell. Mr. and Mrs. R. M. Webb were dinner guests Sunday of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Morris. Mr. and Mrs. Bennett Gilliam of Farmville, spent a few days with Mrs. W. T. Covington. Dinner guests Sunday of Mrs. Charlie Bagby were Mr. and Mrs. L. H. Watson and Misses Susan and Jewel Irby. Mr. Al fred Almond called in this home Sunday afternoon. Mr. and Mrs. W. H.
